Title:
New foliar pathogens occurring on maple trees in Hyrcanian
forests
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes, foliicolous fungi, forest pathology,
Iran, multi-locus phylogeny, four new taxa
Abstract:
Maples (Acer spp., Sapindaceae) are one of the most
important and dominant groups of trees in Hyrcanian forests of Iran.
During our survey of leaf-inhabiting fungi associated with trees in
Hyrcanian forests, several hyphomycetous fungal strains were recovered
from symptomatic leaves of maple trees. The identification of these
isolates was performed using multi-locus phylogenetic analyses coupled
with morphological observations. Based on these data, two new genera
were discovered, which belong in the class Dothideomycetes.
Acericercospora gen. nov. (Mycosphaerellaceae) is introduced to
accommodate Acericercospora hyrcanica sp. nov., causing leaf lesions on
Acer cappadocicum and A. velutinum. Paramycocentrospora gen. nov.
(Dothidotthiaceae) with Paramycocentrospora acericola sp. nov. as type
species, causing leaf lesions on seedlings of Acer sp., are described.
In this paper, detailed descriptions and illustrations are provided for
the new taxa, supplemented by comprehensive comparisons with allied and
similar taxa.
